DOC.brief_summary: Participants will be randomized to undergo a High Tibial Osteotomy (HTO) with or without a knee scope. Patients will be tested in the Gait Lab, will fill out quality-of-life questionnaires, and have a clinical evaluation done preoperative and at each follow-up visit.
DOC.brief_title: High Tibial Osteotomy (HTO) With or Without Arthroscopy of the Knee Joint
DOC.criteria: All patients booked for an HTO due to OA Grades II to IV severity of OA by radiographic evaluation (Kellgren & Lawrence grade) OA of the knee primarily involving the medial compartment Imaging evidence of significant knee joint pathology that would change the decision to do an HTO An arthroscopy of the knee within 2 years of planned surgery Active joint or systemic infection, Major medical illness that would preclude undergoing surgery, Patients who are unwilling or unable to be assessed according to study protocol for two years following surgery Major psychiatric illness, developmental handicap or inability to read and understand the English language
